profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-03 14:01:14 -0400.

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This artificial collection documents university students who served in the military during armed conflicts, particularly during World War II.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection inititally curated by Geoff Williams. Materials were initially rehoused by Miles Lawlor in 2019.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Students and Faculty affiliated with the University have served in the American military going back to the Mexican-American War. Begun in 1999, the Alumni Relations Office began an ongoing project seeking to recognize members of the University at Albany community who had served in the military with a Wall of Honor in the Science Library. The Wall was unveiled as part of Alumni Weekend in 2001.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection was maintained in the original order after it was transferred.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.

The M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collection and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Veterans Project Collection, 1927-2000. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Veterans Collection).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This artificial collection consists of materials assembled as part of the Veterans Project. It includes photographic prints and photocopies, press clippings, correspondence and brief summaries of students' military service. The majority of the materials in the collection relate to service in World War II.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Collection contains CD-Rs, a zip disk and a 3.5' floppy disk.
